downloadTitle: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Integration Services Data Feed Publishing Components
downloadDescription: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Integration Services (SSIS) Data Feed Publishing Components can expose data from various data sources as views in SQL Server 2012 database instances. The data can be consumed as OData feeds by querying the view.
detailsSection:
Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Integration Services (SSIS) Data Feed Publishing Components can expose data from various data sources as views in SQL Server 2012 database instances. The data can be consumed as OData feeds by querying the view.
The Power BI Admin Center, by default, allows you to register only SQL Server data sources. However, you can register SSIS packages as data sources with the Admin Center by using the following Data Feed Publishing Components:
  • Microsoft OLE DB Provider for SSIS (SSISOLEDB).
  • Data Streaming Destination: an SSIS destination component that allows the SSISOLEDB provider to consume output of an SSIS package as a tabular result set.
  • Data Feed Publishing Wizard: a wizard that helps create a view that enables querying the data returned by the SSIS package.
The Data Feed Publishing Components must be installed on an on-premises computer.
See Publish SSIS Packages as OData Feed Sources topic on Office.com for more information. Use Power BI for Office 365 forum for any discussions regarding these components.
systemRequirementsSection:
Other software:
  • SQL Server 2012
  • SQL Server Data Tools for Visual Studio 2010 (or) SQL Server Data Tools – Business Intelligence for Visual Studio 2012
installInstructionSection: Download and run the 32-bit/64-bit installation package to install the SSIS Data Feed Publishing Components on your computer.
